subtitleNullable: list of news titles, date and links, sourced from WaybackMachine
descriptionNullable:
## Content

Kommersant.ru has probably one of the largest Russian news archives available online, it's going back to October 1992
Current dataset contains publishing dates, news urls and news titles from `main`(federal) Kommersant news archive from 6 Oct 1992 till today.


### Columns

1.  **date** - the date this news article was published on, format YYYY-MM-DD
2. **url** - link to the news article as it was archived by wayback machine, it is very possible to get 404 if the article was deleted from kommersant.ru, the best way would be to try to collect the first version of archived link from wayback machine(if it is archived)
3. **title** - title of the news article in Russian

## Brief history of kommersant.ru

In 1989, with the onset of press freedom in Russia, Kommersant was founded under the ownership of businessman and publicist Vladimir Yakovlev. 
The first issue was released in January 1990. It was modeled after Western business journalism.
The newspaper's title is spelled in Russian with a terminal hard sign (ъ) – a letter that is silent at the end of a word in modern Russian, and was thus largely abolished by the post-revolution Russian spelling reform, in reference to a pre-Soviet newspaper of the same name active between 1909 and 1917.
This is played up in the Kommersant logo, which features a script hard sign at the end of somewhat more formal font. The newspaper also refers to itself or its redaction as "Ъ".
Founded as a weekly newspaper, it became popular among business and political elites. It then became a daily newspaper in 1992. It was owned by the businessman Boris Berezovsky from 1999 until 2006, when he sold it to Badri Patarkatsishvili. In September 2006, it was sold to Alisher Usmanov.


### Note 
There are also `regional` archives available, to access specific region daily issue follow directions below:
| Region Name (ENG) | Region Name (RU) | Construct Link As: |
| --- | --- |
| Moscow | Москва |`https://www.kommersant.ru/archive/theme/3378/day/YYYY-MM-DD` |
| Saint Petersburg | Санкт-Петербург | `https://www.kommersant.ru/archive/list/78/day/YYYY-MM-DD` |
| Chernozem region (Voronezh) | Черноземье (Воронеж) | `https://www.kommersant.ru/archive/region/36/day/YYYY-MM-DD` |
| Ural (Ekaterinburg) | Урал (Екатеринбург) | `https://www.kommersant.ru/archive/region/66/day/YYYY-MM-DD` |
| Udmurtia (Izhevsk) | Удмуртия (Ижевск) | `https://www.kommersant.ru/archive/region/18/day/YYYY-MM-DD` |
| Volga - Ural (Kazan) | Волга - Урал (Казань) | `https://www.kommersant.ru/archive/region/16/day/YYYY-MM-DD` |
| Kuban-Chernomorie (Krasnodar) | Кубань-Черноморье (Краснодар) | `https://www.kommersant.ru/archive/region/23/day/YYYY-MM-DD` |
| Central Siberia (Krasnoyarsk) | Центральная Сибирь (Красноярск) | `https://www.kommersant.ru/archive/region/24/day/YYYY-MM-DD` |
| Volga region (Nizhny Novgorod) | Приволжье (Нижний Новгород) | `https://www.kommersant.ru/archive/region/52/day/YYYY-MM-DD` |
| Siberia (Novosibirsk) | Сибирь (Новосибирск) | `https://www.kommersant.ru/archive/region/54/day/YYYY-MM-DD` |
| Kama region (Perm) | Прикамье (Пермь) | `https://www.kommersant.ru/archive/region/59/day/YYYY-MM-DD` |
| South of Russia (Rostov-on-Don) | Юг России (Ростов-на-Дону) | `https://www.kommersant.ru/archive/region/61/day/YYYY-MM-DD` |
| Volga (Samara) | Волга (Самара) | `https://www.kommersant.ru/archive/region/63/day/YYYY-MM-DD` |
| Middle Volga (Saratov) | Средняя Волга (Саратов) | `https://www.kommersant.ru/archive/region/64/day/YYYY-MM-DD` |
| Bashkortostan (Ufa) | Башкортостан (Уфа) | `https://www.kommersant.ru/archive/region/2/day/YYYY-MM-DD` |
| South Ural (Chelyabinsk) | Южный Урал (Челябинск) | `https://www.kommersant.ru/archive/region/74/day/YYYY-MM-DD` |
| Yaroslavl | Ярославль | `https://www.kommersant.ru/archive/region/76/day/YYYY-MM-DD` |
title: Russia Daily News Titles 1992-2022 (kommersant.ru)
